org.hkijena.acaq5.api.algorithm

Class ACAQAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hkijena.acaq5.api.algorithm.ACAQGraphNode
      • org.hkijena.acaq5.api.algorithm.ACAQAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ACAQValidatable, ACAQParameterCollection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ACAQIteratingAlgorithm, ACAQMergingAlgorithm, ACAQSimpleIteratingAlgorithm, DefineRectangularRoiAlgorithm, FileDataSource, FileListDataSource, FolderDataSource, FolderListDataSource, GraphWrapperAlgorithm, ImageTypeConverter, IOInterfaceAlgorithm, MergeDataSlots, MultiParameterAlgorithm, ParametersDataDefinition, ParametersDataTableDefinition, PlotGeneratorAlgorithm, SplitByAnnotation

    public abstract class ACAQAlgorithm
extends ACAQGraphNode
    An ACAQGraphNode that contains a non-empty workload. This class contains additional parameters to control the workload behavior. Please prefer to use this class or its derivatives if you write your algorithms.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ACAQAlgorithm.StateSerializer
      Serializer used by getStateId() It automatically skips name, compartment, description, slot configuration, and UI parameters that are not relevant to the state

      • runPassThrough

        protected void runPassThrough()
        Runs the pass through. Override this for custom implementations if you want

      • canAutoPassThrough

        protected boolean canAutoPassThrough()
        Returns true if the algorithm can automatically apply pass-through This is only possible if there is at most one input and at most one output. Input must be compatible to the output.
        Returns:
        if the algorithm can automatically apply pass-through

      • canPassThrough

        protected boolean canPassThrough()
        Returns true if the algorithm can apply pass-through. Override this method to implement your own checks
        Returns:
        true if the algorithm can apply pass-through

      • getStateId

        public String getStateId()
        Returns a unique identifier that represents the state of the algorithm. Defaults to a JSON-serialized representation using the ACAQAlgorithm.StateSerializer. Override this method if you have external influences.
        Returns:
        the state id

      • getThreadPool

        public ACAQFixedThreadPool getThreadPool()

      • setThreadPool

        public void setThreadPool(ACAQFixedThreadPool threadPool)
        Sets the thread pool. Depending on the implementation, the pool is just ignored.
        Parameters:
        threadPool - can be null (forces single-threaded run)
